why_it_matters: The most common indication for the prescribing of amoxicillin in primary care
is the treatment of respiratory-tract infections. NICE guidance recommends for example that, where amoxicillin is used for cough, the dose is
500mg three times a day for 5 days.
Where greater than 5 days treatment is prescribed for these indications, this increases both the unnecessary prescribing of antibiotics, as well as cost.
There are however some indications which require higher doses/longer durations of amoxicillin for example, treatment of H. pylori.
NHS England National Medicines Optimisation Opportunities for 2024/25
identify use of the shortest effective antibiotic courses as an area for improvement, and suggests that 60% of amoxicillin prescriptions should be 5-day courses by March 2025.
